com.orindasoft.pub
Class UiLog

java.lang.Object
  com.orindasoft.pub.GenericLog
      com.orindasoft.pub.TextLog
          com.orindasoft.pub.UiLog
All Implemented Interfaces:
LogInterface
public class UiLog
extends TextLog
implements LogInterface

This is an implementation of LogInterface that uses a javax.swing.JLabel field to display messages. it also does modal messages and will log them if asked. See LogInterface
(c) Copyright 2003 - 2015 Orinda Software Ltd

Version:
6.0
Author:
Orinda Software

Constructor Detail

UiLog

public UiLog(java.lang.String theDirectoryName,
             java.lang.String thePrefix,
             javax.swing.JLabel theLabel,
             javax.swing.JFrame theFrame)
Create an instance of UiLog.

Parameters:
String - theDirectoryName A string containing a logging directory path name. If the directory doesn't exist we'll attempt to create it. If we can't create it then we lose the ability to log messages.
String - thePrefix A string containing a the prefix used to name the log files.
Jlabel - theLabel A JLabel. We assume that it's a suitable location for a message, such as a line at the bottom of the screen.
JFrame - theFrame The current application frame. We need to know this in order to refresh the graphics context so that messages will become visible to the end user.
Method Detail

useJTextArea

public void useJTextArea(boolean useArea)
Prevent or allow messages from being written to the text area as well as the log file.

public void clearJTextArea()
Clear the text area

Set a new Text Area

mapMessageType

public static int mapMessageType(java.lang.String messageType)
Map LogInterface message types to JOptionPane message types

Parameters:
String - messageType A valid LogInterface messageType, such as LogInterface.DEBUG, LogInterface.INFO, LogInterface.WARN, LogInterface.ERROR, LogInterface.SYSERR
Returns:
A JOptionPane message type.
See Also:
LogInterface, JOptionPane
